page.title: 08Walking Day / Church
page.content: The church at Winwick is dedicated to St. Oswald who was the Christian King of Northumbria and was thought to have been killed in battle against a Pagan king somewhere near the church in the year 642A.D. There has been a church on this site for nearly l300 years. Inside the church there is a remnant of a Saxon Preaching Cross believed to be about 1000 years old.The first church was mentioned in the original Domesday Book of 1086.In the graveyard there are gravestones which date back to 1600. Inside the church there are brasses, one of which is unique, which means there is no other like it. It shows a priest, robed for Mass, wearing the spurs of a knight and wearing the tonsure. This is the Legh Brass. Sir Peter Legh became a priest after his wife died.
